title: Our 52 Places to Go Lists Show How Travel Has Changed Over 20 Years
description: When The New York Times’s 52 Places to Go list made its debut in 2005, world travelers had no smartphones, no Instagram and no Google Maps. As the list turns 20 years old, our reporter Tariro Mzezewa gives insight into how travel has changed in the last two decades.
author: Tariro Mzezewa, Christina Shaman, Karen Hanley, James Surdam and Ray Jones
excerpt: When The New York Times’s 52 Places to Go list made its debut in 2005, world travelers had no smartphones, no Instagram and no Google Maps. As the list turns 20 years old, our reporter Tariro Mzezewa gives insight into how travel has changed in the last two decades.
text: By Tariro Mzezewa, Christina Shaman, Karen Hanley, James Surdam and Ray Jones•January 7, 2025When The New York Times’s 52 Places to Go list made its debut in 2005, world travelers had no smartphones, no Instagram and no Google Maps. As the list turns 20 years old, our reporter Tariro Mzezewa gives insight into how travel has changed in the last two decades.
html:
By Tariro Mzezewa, Christina Shaman, Karen Hanley, James Surdam and Ray Jones•January 7, 2025

When The New York Times’s 52 Places to Go list made its debut in 2005, world travelers had no smartphones, no Instagram and no Google Maps. As the list turns 20 years old, our reporter Tariro Mzezewa gives insight into how travel has changed in the last two decades.
